In a speaking class, the teacher facilitates the lesson by observing this procedure presenting a weather report, causing interaction by asking questions related to the text (weather report), taking notes of the students responses in the form of content and grammar points (Verb Tense), providing exercises individually or collaboratively for mastery of what have been presented, and letting the students perform a task (preparing a brochure on what to do during inclement weather conditions. question:

Which of the following is/are an area involved in speaking?
I. Form and Mechanics including pronunciations, grammar, and vocabulary which are the components in using the right words in the right order with the correct pronunciation.
II. Functions such as transactions and interaction which require knowing when clarity of message is essential (transaction/information exchange) and when precise understanding is not required (interaction/relationship building).
III. Social and cultural rules and norms including turn-taking, rate of speech, length of pauses between speakers, relative roles of participants, and understanding how to take into account who is speaking to when whom, in what circumstances, about what, and for what reason.

2). A video showing people who use the language correctly. Which act is demonstrated by the teacher to make the students reflect and become more aware of what to look for to learn the language?

In using Think-Pair-Share strategy in a speaking class, which should be the teacher AVOID? 
I. Initiate the task by posing a question, wait for a single student to respond, evaluate, and provide feedback.
II. Pose a question, give students time to think or consider the question, discuss their responses with partners, and share their answers with the entire class. 
III. Use any question of interest that may resemble these ones: “What do you consider as the most effective time of studying your lessons?”, “How can you challenge students‟ apprehension to speak?”, “When was the last time you lied?”, “What makes you laugh or smile?”, “An eye for an eye will make the world blind.”, etc.
Considering the principles in teaching minimal pair drills, which of the following should the teacher AVOID?

choice2: Provide over drill and spend more time in the production of sound in similar contexts.
choice3: Use familiar words if possible and present one pronunciation problem at a time, e.g. /I/ vs /i/ in bit-beat first before ship and sheep.

question: In teaching speaking, which of the following statements should the teacher observe to demonstrate the principles in teaching pattern drills?

choice4: my joining the English Enhancement Program

question: What problem do you encounter when you could NOT find the exact term or word to use in English such as the different kinds of banana (saging na saba, senyorita, latundan, etc.)?
choice1: The source-language word is semantically complex.
choice4: The source and target languages make different distinction in meaning.

question: When translating Derrida‟s work, writers need to observe abusive fidelity. Which of the following may be added while maintaining Derrida‟s syntax, lexicon, and pun?

In the modes of Language of Interpretation, which among the following is where person interprets the text to a language common to every interpreter who in turn renders the message to his/her respective target languages?
As with single words, an idiom can sometimes be omitted altogether in the target text ___________.
choice2: if its meaning cannot be easily paraphrased
choice3: if it has no close match in the target language
choice4: if the term has no superordinate
answerKey: if the term has no superordinate

question: Which word is erroneous in the sentence “Who do you choose to lead the nation”?
The difference between “don't oppose” and “don't whimper” lies in their ____________.
Which of the following components are required by most translation perspectives?
choice1: Sensitivity to style and faithfulness to register
choice2: Sensitivity to style and faithfulness to content
choice3: Faithfulness to register and avoidance of utopia
choice4: Faithfulness to content and avoidance of domestication
answerKey: Sensitivity to style and faithfulness to content

question: Which grammatical categories would affect the translation of the word ‘heiress’ to a Filipino term?
Which type of error is evident in the sentence “I came, I saw, I conquered”?
Which strategy is used in translating the statement “I didn’t expect Myrna is an onion-skinned girl to Hindi ko inaasahan na si Myrna ay matampuhin?”
choice1: Translation by omission of play on idiom
choice2: Using an idiom of similar meaning and form
choice3: Using an idiom of similar meaning but dissimilar form
answerKey: Using an idiom of similar meaning but dissimilar form
